channel.title: [WIP]Divine Order throne room [WIP]
channel.description:
Yes, 100% Made by me. Ever wounder where the power of divine comes from? Well it drives from the sacred divine water, Where the sigils have been blessed. This is only one of the rooms I have made for my new dungeons, I just thought this was the best of them all. The desert was Arcane, Jungle is Divine, Ice is elysian, And Water is Spectral. I have made all new NPC's, And Rewards :D But, This project is only still 20% done. But so far it all works in my client, And is coded fine so I am hoping it stays that way. Here is a pic of what it looks like so far, The room is like 10% done its self. Still alot of detail to add.
[IMG]http://i666.photobucket.com/albums/vv23/uberxgod/worksofar.jpg[/img]
Ignore how the floor shading looks, I have it like that for the textures.
*Update* Finished a little, Still working on it. Atm have this, This will be the HD part. [IMG]http://i666.photobucket.com/albums/vv23/uberxgod/hdpic.jpg[/img]

item.title: [WIP]Divine Order throne room [WIP]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“man_killerx, post:13, topic:358762”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=455261.msg3334371#msg3334371 date=1283765348]
No but seriously man killer, why don’t you use the more advanced programs? You never replied to me last time.
You could really do some great things, earn money out of it and even go into a professional 3d architecture career, you’re never gonna achieve that with freeware metasequoia.
[/quote]
Because its not the program that makes the models, I don’t need fancy rendering tools, Or auto smoothing tools. I have blender, I have Maya, I have 3ds, I have all of those. The only program I will upgrade to is Maya, And that is for the animation that it offers.[/quote]

Even Maya is good, you could go onto create small animated character sketches even?
Wouldn’t you like to achieve realism with your models though, create visualisations of things like your house or just small objects like your phone for example? Trust me it’s worth it when you put in the work, you get a real sense of achievement.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP]Divine Order throne room [WIP]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“man_killerx, post:13, topic:358762”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=455261.msg3334371#msg3334371 date=1283765348]
No but seriously man killer, why don’t you use the more advanced programs? You never replied to me last time.
You could really do some great things, earn money out of it and even go into a professional 3d architecture career, you’re never gonna achieve that with freeware metasequoia.
[/quote]
Because its not the program that makes the models, I don’t need fancy rendering tools, Or auto smoothing tools. I have blender, I have Maya, I have 3ds, I have all of those. The only program I will upgrade to is Maya, And that is for the animation that it offers.[/quote]
No, but the tools enable for further advances. Meta has a very obscure way of doing things and severely limits the ability to model to a full potential. All you really do by sticking with Meta is limit the amount of progress you can really make. Meta lacks on some important tools, and the rendering factor does not do any model justice.

Read full topic
